title: Industrial Experiences
description:
The Industrial Experiences track caters for work being done in industry where HCI-related area such as Interaction Design and User Experience plays a role. The track is aimed at professionals who want to share their experiences and highlight their work to the international community. We welcome submissions from individuals from research groups, corporations and government institutions.

In the previous INTERACT editions, Industrial Experience track papers addressed the following topics:
Best Practices in Research and Development
New work methodologies
Case Studies
Collaboration Paradigms
Risk, Law and Ethics
Smart Phone & Tablets to wearables UI evolution (Health, Sports and personal productivity)
Innovative Voice Interfaces
Gesture Interactions
Interaction for Internet of Things
Robotics in Human Interactions
Virtual Reality/Mixed Reality Worlds
New Interaction Paradigms
Interaction Innovation in Automotive Industry
Data Visualization Techniques and Solutions
details:
**Key Dates**
- Submission: 19 April 2023, 23:59 (anywhere on earth)
- Notification: 24 May 2023
- Camera-Ready: 14 June 2023

**Submission and Publication Summary**
- Reviewing process: curated
- Anonymous submission: No
- Submission length: 4 pages + 1 page for references
- Online Submission: [PCS Submission System](https://new.precisionconference.com/interact)
- Proceedings: [Springer LNCS Series](https://link.springer.com/conference/interact)

**Author Guidelines**
Industrial Experience papers should be formatted according to [Springer LNCS](https://www.springer.com/computer/lncs?SGWID=0-164-6-793341-0)  format. Authors should consult [Springer’s authors’ guidelines](https://www.interact2021.org/templates/Springer_Guidelines_for_Authors_of_Proceedings_CS.pdf) and use their proceedings templates, either for [LaTeX](https://www.interact2021.org/templates/llncs2e.zip) or for [Word](https://www.interact2021.org/templates/splnproc1703.zip), to prepare their papers. Springer’s proceedings LaTeX templates are also available in [Overleaf](https://www.overleaf.com/latex/templates/springer-lecture-notes-in-computer-science/kzwwpvhwnvfj#.WsdHOy5uZpg).
Accepted Industrial Experience papers papers must be presented at the conference. They will be published in [Springer LNCS Series](https://link.springer.com/conference/interact) if they are between 4-5 pages long.
Industrial Experience papers may optionally be accompanied by a video not exceeding 30 MB in size. Video figures will be published online and may be used for publicity.


**Upon Acceptance of your submission**
If a submission is accepted to appear at the conference, the contact person will receive further instructions regarding the inclusion of their paper in the conference proceedings, as well as instructions for the Industrial Experience presentation at the conference.

**At the Conference**
Accepted Industrial Experiences will be presented during the conference. Authors will be expected to attend the conference and will be assigned a time and location to present their Industrial Experience to conference attendees. Those authors who cannot travel will be able to present and participate remotely in the conference.

**Further Information**
If you require any further information please contact the Industrial Experiences track Chair: Helen Petrie and Jose Abdelnour-Nocera 

E-mail: [industrial-experiences@interact2023.org](industrial-experiences@interact2023.org)
